subject: "Beautiful Tests" chapter in the O'Reilly book "Beautiful Code"
msgSnippet: Earlier this year, I had the honor of being asked to write a chapter for O Reilly s book: Beautiful Code: Leading Programmers Explain How They Think. How
messageBody:
Earlier this year, I had the honor of being asked to write a chapter
for O'Reilly's book: "Beautiful Code: Leading Programmers Explain How
They Think."

How could I say no?

I simply couldn't refuse an opportunity to have my words share the
same book spine with programming legends whose shoes I am unfit to
shine (like Brian Kernighan and Jon Bentley).

More importantly, I wanted to make sure that the book included at
least one chapter on the beauty of tests.

I strongly encourage you to check out the entire book, but since
O'Reilly has given the authors permission to share their own chapters,
you can download a PDF of "Beautiful Tests" and see how I use, misuse,
and abuse JUnit to test "that pesky binary search":

http://www.junitfactory.com/articles/beautiful-code/

Alberto
